Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Elevator opens on Andy, who starts lip dub to the Isley Brothers "Nobody But Me", joined by the rest of the Office]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [to Toby, who's filming] You fallin' behind.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [jumps in front of camera] Wuphf.com!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ryan, we're doing the dance!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This is how you build a business. This is how you make it in this country.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [Bluetooth rings] You got Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: -and you jump in front of them.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You make it so hard to love you sometimes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Still behind.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [closing door] I said I didn't want to be on the internet!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Go, go, go, go!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [performs magic-tricks while lip-syncing]

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Streamers! [everyone throws streamers in the air and starts dancing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hiya! Ha! [climbs on Phyllis' desk and starts kicking things off, bites off the head of a stuffed animal]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight! [Dwight pulls out a hunting knife and jumps off desk]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Are you crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [song ends] Toby, how did we do?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, that was better.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoo! We did it! [everyone starts cheering]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I suppose summer had to end sometime. It's sad, though, because I had a great summer. I got West Nile virus, lost a ton of weight. Then I went back to the lake. I stepped on a piece of glass in the parking lot, which hurt. That got infected even though I peed on it. Saw 'Inception.' Or at least I dreamt I did.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Brocolli Rob, obviously, will be there.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes, of course.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And JC. We call him Blorville, because he looks like a black Orville Redenbacher.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Who's the guy who invented the peanut?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Sorry, didn't mean to interrupt.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not at all.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm gonna head back to Siberia there. Ciao. [he and Erin kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I started dating Erin this summer. It has been, in a word, exquisite.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Gabe is awesome. He has accomplished so much career-wise and height-wise. Thank God he's my boss because I would not have said yes to a first date if I didn't have to, but... it's been great.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Am I angry that Gabe stole my girlfriend over the summer? No. I've been through anger-management, OK? So right now, I am sitting on a nice beach at Cape Cod, gazing out across the whitecaps. Oh, look, it's a humpback whale. How pretty. He's eating Gabe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [goes to change thermostat as Dwight puts a locked cover over it] Hey. What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: From now on, if you're hot, sit on an ice pack.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, what if you're cold?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Like you'd ever be cold, Kevin. Stop asking me hypothetical questions, OK? I'm too busy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight, I don't know if you heard, but we're supposed to be drinking out of weird backpacks instead of cups, like regular people. Oh, you did hear.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [drinking from Camelback] Jim, you have one job to do. And you do it forgettably. Those of us who are busy require hands-free hydration.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute, star salesman, beet farmer, bed-and-breakfast proprietor, aspiring freelance bodyguard. Add to that list owner of this building. Then burn the list.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This summer, I did the minority executive training program at Yale. You guys, I'm, like, really smart now. You don't even know. You could ask me, "Kelly, what's the biggest company in the world?" And I'd be like, "blah blah blah, blah blah blah blah blah blah," giving you the exact right answer.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: Coffee Monkey's arrived.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The coffee's supposed to be here at 9.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: Here you go, Big O. Tiny. [hands Kevin his coffee] Darryl Hannah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It says decaf. You get me decaf?

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: Ooh, yeah. Must've been some sort of mix-up there. You could just drink it, or I could drive all the way back?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: My summer, I, um, blew out my knee playing softball. Ended up watching CNN most of the time. I don't know how we're going to get out of Afghanistan. I hate the new assistant. He's only been here for a week, and I hate him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: New guy sucks. Calls me the Nard-Man. I'm the Nard-Dog, okay? Nard-man is my father.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: My name is Luke Cooper. I love cinema. My favorite movies are Citizen Kane and The Boondock Saints.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That kid is the worst. Needs to be fired, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He's not the worst, okay? He's not the worst. You know who's the worst? That intern we had a few years ago. That guy-remember? Eeeh! That face, how ugly he was? He was the worst. Good worker, though. [starts drinking coffee] Ah! It's not cappuccino.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He messed yours up to.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: He's got to go, Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's just coffee, guys! But, yeah, I'll look into it, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that's a lot of keys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The bigger the key chain, the more powerful the man.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's right. The janitor said that. By the way, the raccoons are back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think they run through these panels and then down under the map. I wouldn't know for sure cause I don't have a trained ear. That's why I have to use one of these. [pulls out stethoscope]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Give me that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. Wait, and this. [hands Dwight a hammer]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Go get 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What happened to me this summer? Dwight bought the building, so actually, this has been the busiest summer of my life.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Jim quietly takes Dwight's keychain and starts adding keys to it, Pam giggles] Hey, what's so funny over here? Ha. Very nice. Give me my keys. [removes keys and throws them at Jim] Ha. Ha. Not. Funny. Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Don't worry about it. I was just gonna put a couple keys on it every day until Christmas. Then his pants would have fallen down, which was a little gift to me, but...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It was really funny.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it would have been. So unprofessional, Mrs. Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Luke? Luke!

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: What's up, Venus?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Did you send those samples to Justin at Lehigh Motors yesterday? Because he didn't get 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: Uh, if you asked me to do it, I'm sure I did it. Yeah, strawberries are ripe.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, turn off the Chumbawamba and scram, twerp.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: You don't have to yell.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, rude. Luke, I want you to go to the supermarket for me.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: What for?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To get some ice cream for everybody. It's national ice cream afternoon. Great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And another thing I did this summer, I hired my nephew.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Having Luke here is a pretty big deal for me, because his mother, who also happens to be my half-sister, kind of cut me off from that side of the family 15 years a- 14. The last time I saw Luke was the opening day of 'Ace Ventura II' and that was '95, so yes, 15 years on the dot. Anyway, I lost him in a forest.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't bother Luke.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why is there a circle with a line through it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That means don't. Haven't you seen Ghostbusters, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, but it's like you're saying we should bother Luke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it... Yes, okay, right. [erases don't] All right, yep. My bad. I got it. Here we go. [writes "Don't" in front of symbol]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Don't don't bother Luke. Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on. Okay, um... [draws a circle around "Don't" with a line through it] That's as clear as I can make it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, why can't we bother Luke? He deserves it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because I don't want it getting back to Sabre that we're yelling at assistants. I think it would reflect poorly on us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who's gonna tell on us? Gabe?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: That'd be hilarious. Uh, "Jo, they're creating a hostile work environment. Stop 'em."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope, it won't be Gabe but actually, there is somebody in the office that is very, very close to Luke.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How close?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, Dwight, he wiped his butt. Is that close enough for you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Guys, I think Michael and Luke are related.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No, Toby. He's not. Yes he is. He's my nephew.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Luke is my nephew.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, that's nepotism. Luke is getting special treatment because he's your nephew.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, exactly. That is a very nice way of putting it, Oscar. Mixing family and business is a beautiful thing.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What's wrong with a level playing field?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you think they should have had open auditions for the band Hanson? What if no one named Hanson showed up? That wouldn't even make sense. Or what if they just hired the littlest kid and a 50-year-old guy who was a murderer? Really safe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, man, so many points being made.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I couldn't care less about nepotism. But, I'm loving the debate. Great minds battling it out. And I've got a front row seat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God, when he needed help on Earth, who did he hire? Jesus Christ, his son.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's a really tight argument.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But you're comparing you and Luke to God and Jesus.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! No. I'm just saying, why does God get to do something that I don't?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This is hypothetical. We're talking about Luke who happens to be terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then, why aren't you bugging me to fire everybody who's bad? You just want me to fire Luke. That's reverse nepotism. He should not be punished because he is related to me and bad at what he does!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I would just like to say something off of what Darryl said about the level playing field. That is actually a zoning issue. So, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: If there's nothing wrong with this, Michael, why have you been keeping it a secret?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because I wanted you to come to me and say, "Wow, he is so great." And I was gonna say, "Well, it's in the genes." And I was actually gonna be wearing jeans. And I'd point to them, right? No. But you ruined it. So, thank you very much. Here he comes. Guys, look. I don't want you to treat him like anyone else in the office. I just want you to treat him like my nephew. Hey, there he is.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey! Ice cream afternoon!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoo! Whoo! Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, soy ice cream? Did you get real ice cream?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Or enough for everyone?

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: No, man. There was no list. Uh, but I got bagel chips.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ah, my favorite part of an ice cream party. The bagel chips.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Clutch cream run, bro.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Get whatever you want, on me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You really think you can make it up to me with food?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know. That usually works.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I feel horrible for blowing Jim's prank. I don't know if you can tell, but he's mildly upset. And Dwight hasn't been messed with in a while, so he's become a monster. I need to make this right.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I came down here to feed the feral cats like I usually do and I found something unsavory in the back of your nephew's car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, you know what? Just -just back off! Back off!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, take a look. It's all the packages he was supposed to overnight. He never bothered to send them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, those might be his. He might own an Ebay store.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. That's exactly what my first thought was. And then I remembered having a conversation with him where he was like, "I don't own an Ebay store," so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, ok. You know what? This is disgusting. This is like a witch hunt. This is like the Blair Witch Hunt project.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh sure, those are the expense reports that corporate was waiting for yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Let's just make this kid open this damn car.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh my gosh, those are the pants he wanted to return to Talbots.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm reconsidering sending them back anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You get that kid to open this car, or I'm gonna do it myself... by calling Tripple A.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait a minute.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [breaks into the car] I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't-all right. Well, ok, you've just committed a felony.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yep, here they are.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yep, I just lost a client cause I swore I sent these samples on time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This kid's costing us sales, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, do you want to try them on again to see.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I know they fit. It's not about the fit.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Why is this my problem, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because Gabe tattled. I was perfectly happy to just hide it from you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Those overnight packages needed to go out, and Michael refuses to hold the guilty party accountable.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Lower yourself, Gabe. I don't wanna be having a conversation with your crotch. Ok, educate me now why you won't fire the boy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't have all the facts.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Which are?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love him.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh, God. How far has it gone?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. He's my nephew.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, I got a nephew too. But he don't work for me. You know why? Cause he's a screw-up. He can swim in my pool but he can't come in my house.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, this office is my pool. And my house is my house. And I just want my nephew to work in my pool.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: If you keep him, Michael, I'm gonna hold you accountable for him. You're on the hook for this kid. You got that? Cover his ass like tighty-whities.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will cover his ass like moss on a Mississippi tree stump.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Was how I put it not clear enough? I mean, you had to go and make up your own saying? Deal with it, boys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Luke and I have been working side-by-side as master and commander. Me as master, he as commander. Occasionally he will need a little push, and I will do that, and he'll slow down, and I'll push him again. That's the thing with kids, you have to keep pushing. You have to push them until they push you back. And then you push some more. It's all about give and take, but mostly it's about pushing each other.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. This'll be easy. So just, like, rearrange the buttons and stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah. Like when he presses "Doors closed" the doors open. Or he presses "lobby" it goes to third floor, stuff like that. Can you do that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. Let me take a look at the circus board.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight is about to get so Pammed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, did you SMS text message me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I wanted to show you something in the lobby. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as elevator doors won't shut] Okay, that's weird. Just hitting "door closed." What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There we go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is this elevator going up? Hey, the elevator is disobeying us! [elevator stops between floors] Okay, okay. We are stuck. We are stuck. Hank, Hank! Can you hear us? Oh, my God. Okay. Emergency protocol.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let's just calm down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, try and pry open those front doors, immediately.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Use your talons! Pry 'em open! [starts to urinate in elevator corner]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, Dwi-Oh, my God!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, don't look, freak!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, what are you doing!? We've only been in here for, like, two seconds!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've got 56 ounces of fluid in my bladder! And we have to establish a pee corner!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You've gotta be kidding me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Luke is going to use his laser pointer to point to account setup. You click on that first, then a whole new-Not, no, no, no! [Luke points laser at Oscar's forehead] Luke, come on. Come on. Not on Oscar's head. Alright. Luke, come on. Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: What? I'm stopping it. That's what you said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me the pointer.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: So you just want me to move it? You're being totally unclear here. I'm just gonna go ahead and move it. [points it at Angela's chest]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, just power it down. No, no, no, no, no. Not on Angela's boob. Come on. Come on. Luke, seriously.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: All right, fine. Fine. I'll just go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: I'm gone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Okay. Good job. Okay, email accounts. So we're starting with account setup-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, my God, is it in my eyeball? I think he's burning my eye.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Michael, do something.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Sack up, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, can I have that?

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, I am going to count down from five.

Quote.Speaker: Both
Quote.Text: Five, four...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Both
Quote.Text: Three, two, one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give-okay. Alright, give it up.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [bending Luke over desk, spanking him repeatedly] You are going to learn to be more professional, Luke!

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: What the?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what you're going to do, Luke!

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: What the hell was that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I had to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Luke
Quote.Text: Hey, [bleep] this! Screw it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Are we good? [Luke runs out crying] You're okay. He's okay. There are many different schools of thought on capital punishment.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That was awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Texas justice.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, your nephew is so lame.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: He's been trashing us relentlessly on Twitter. Yeah, it's funny stuff, but mean.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You follow him on Twitter?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Everywhere I look it's Betty White this and Betty White that. Finally a kid that's not talking about Betty White. Of course I follow him.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Michael, you just physically assaulted an employee. Can we talk in private?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, of course. What is this in reference to?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, hey Jim. Some prankster switched the elevator buttons on Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I did not do this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know. Yeah, and it was going really great at first. I got video.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is impressive.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you know... they don't call me the Bart Simpson of Scranton for nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do they call you that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They do call me that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on, give me your hand. I'll help you down.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nope. Scared of getting cut in half. Also, there's pee on the floor.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh! Of course there is. Hey, Chinese tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How ya doin'?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pretty good. You must be almost out of water.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stop drinking the water! Stop!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Phyllis and Andy act out Luke getting spanked] No, no, no, no. It's the other hand. Right hand. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would have been nice to work with my family. It would have been nice if Luke had been able to stay here. But he couldn't. These things seldom work out. I don't know how Ringling Brothers do it. Night after night, town after town, all across America. You would think they'd be sick of each other by now. But, clearly, they make it work. And my hat's off to them.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Dwight starts aggressively spanking Andy] Whoa! Whoa! Hey. Whoa. Dwight! Stop!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Legal says the best way to protect us from a lawsuit is to call this a stress-induced outburst. You will have to undergo six sessions of counseling.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's it? Really? That's nothing. All right. That's highway robbery.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Good. Well, that's the spirit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can do that.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: And, uh, you will do your counseling right here, because our HR staff are all certified counselors.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Wait, what?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm really looking forward to working with you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is there another option?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: The alternative is termination. [Michael stares off, considering termination...]
